DEMO-101.description: Add OAuth2 authentication flow for user login. Support Google and GitHub providers. This is a demo ticket for testing the PR review agent.
acceptanceCriteria: User can log in with Google OAuth2
User can log in with GitHub OAuth2
Session is maintained for 24 hours
Logout functionality works correctly
Error handling for failed authentication
All authentication endpoints return proper HTTP status codes
Tokens are securely stored and encrypted

DEMO-102.description: Implement user profile CRUD operations with proper validation and error handling.
acceptanceCriteria: User can view their profile
User can update their profile information
Profile updates are validated before saving
Error messages are clear and user-friendly
Profile data is sanitized to prevent XSS attacks

DEMO-103.description: Add rate limiting to all API endpoints to prevent abuse and ensure fair usage.
acceptanceCriteria: Rate limits are enforced per user/IP
Rate limit headers are included in responses
Rate limit exceeded returns 429 status code
Rate limits are configurable per endpoint
Rate limit information is logged for monitoring

DEMO-104.summary: Harden authentication flows and error handling
DEMO-104.description: Refactor auth service to meet security guidelines and API standards.
acceptanceCriteria: Secrets (client secrets, signing keys) are not hardcoded and are loaded from environment or secrets manager
Tokens are never stored in plaintext; use hashed or encrypted storage
Return correct HTTP status codes for auth errors (401), missing sessions (404), rate limit (429), and server errors (500)
Implement rate limiting per IP/user for login endpoints; include X-RateLimit-* headers
Remove SQL injection risks; all queries must be parameterized
No sensitive information (tokens, secrets, stack traces) is logged or returned to clients
Input validation is enforced on all request parameters (length, format, allowed values)
Add structured error responses following API Design Guidelines
